edu.jhu.rebar

Class IndexedTokenization

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jhu.rebar.IndexedProto<edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Concrete.Tokenization>
      • edu.jhu.rebar.IndexedTokenization
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TokenLatticeIndexedTokenization, TokenListIndexedTokenization

    public abstract class IndexedTokenization
extends IndexedProto<edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Concrete.Tokenization>
    A wrapper for a Tokenization objects that makes them easier to use. In particular, this wrapper provides: - Automatic indexing of tokens by id - Automatic indexing of POS taggings - Methods to extract the best token sequence - Methods to extract bags of words or bags of ngrams Two subclasses, one for lattices??

      • getNextToken

        public abstract edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Concrete.Token getNextToken(int tokenId)
                                                          throws RebarException
        Return the token that follows the specified token, or null if no such token exists. In the case of token lattices, return the token that is most likely to follow this token. If two tokens are equally likely to follow this token, then it is undefined which one is returned.
        Throws:
        RebarException

      • getPrevToken

        public abstract edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Concrete.Token getPrevToken(int tokenId)
                                                          throws RebarException
        Return the token that precedes the specified token, or null if no such token exists. In the case of token lattices, return the token that is most likely to precede this token. If two tokens are equally likely to precede this token, then it is undefined which one is returned.
        Throws:
        RebarException
